name: You're Number One! Online Trivia | Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: A unicorn is a horse with one _______.
questions.explanation:
horn.

	A unicorn is a mythical horse with a single horn in the middle of its forehead. Most unicorns seem to be white or silver.

questions.text: Which are most similar to a unicycle?
options: a life cycle and a rinse cycle
questions.explanation:
a bicycle and a tricycle.

	Some circus clowns and acrobats ride tall, one-wheeled unicycles. They are very hard to balance. Bicycles have two wheels, and tricycles have three. A cyclone is a twisting windstorm and a cyclops is a mythical one-eyed monster.

questions.text: A solitary person is someone who is _______.
options: sharing a room with a brother or sister
questions.explanation:
all by him- or herself.

	The word "solitary" has the same root as the words "sole" and "solo."

bring them together.

	When people are unified, they can work together as one group to get things done.

questions.text: What does this expression mean? "All for one and one for all!"
questions.correct: Each person in this group is willing to help the other members.
options: This group is better than most other groups.
To get into this group, you must pass a difficult test.
Each person in this group knows every other group member.
questions.explanation:
Each person in this group is willing to help the other members.

	When people have team spirit, they work for the good of their whole team. They are not just "out for themselves."

questions.text: When someone sings a solo, he sings _______.
questions.explanation:
by himself.

	In a duet, two people sing together or play music together.

un.

	The numbers from one to ten in French are un, deux, trois, quatre, cinq, six, sept, huit, neuf, dix.

questions.text: Which is true of a unique artwork?
questions.correct: There is no other artwork exactly like it.
options: It is a painting, a sculpture, or a drawing.
questions.explanation:
There is no other artwork exactly like it.

	Saying that something is "one in a million" is a way of saying that it is unique.

questions.text: What does the following sentence mean? Ms. Britt is the sole owner of this restaurant.
questions.correct: She is the restaurant's only owner.
options: She is lucky to own this restaurant.
She and her partner own this restaurant.
She is happy to own the restaurant.
questions.explanation:
She is the restaurant's only owner.

	"Sole" means "only." It is also the name of a type of fish.

questions.text: What does the word "United" mean in the name "United States of America"?
questions.explanation:
forming one country.

	The Latin saying "e pluribus unum" appears on the U.S. one-cent coin. It means "From many, one."
